page.title: A Gourmet Journey Through Regional Georgian Cuisine
page.intro: Explore the rich and diverse flavors of Georgia through the lens of its distinct regions. From the wine-soaked valleys of Kakheti to the alpine pastures of Tusheti, discover traditional dishes, hidden gems, and where to taste them authentically.

sections.title: Kakheti
sections.intro: Kakheti is Georgia’s famed wine country – rolling vineyards, oak-smoked Saperavi reds and amber Rkatsiteli whites – and its hearty cuisine reflects that abundance. Meat is king here, often paired with tangy vinegars and aromatics. The region gave birth to tonis puri (დონერი პური), a rustic bread baked in a deep clay oven (tone). Kakhetian table staples include grilled meats and rich stews.

dishes.name: Mtsvadi
dishes.description: Juicy pork, beef, or lamb skewers marinated in garlic, coriander, and local spices, charred over an open fire and dipped in tangy plum sauce (tkemali).

dishes.name: Chakapuli
dishes.description: Spring lamb stew simmered with green tarragon, cilantro, spring onions, and tart green plums, celebrated during Easter.

dishes.name: Khinkali
dishes.description: Soup dumplings filled with a mixture of meat (traditionally pork and beef), enjoyed by sipping the broth first and then eating the dough and filling.

dishes.name: Chikhirtma
dishes.description: Silky chicken soup thickened with beaten eggs and soured with vinegar, a popular hangover cure.

dishes.name: Churchkhela
dishes.description: Strings of walnuts dipped in boiled grape must (tatara) and dried into sausage-like candies, a staple at harvest and New Year.

sections.title: Imereti
sections.intro: Imereti’s lush valleys and orchards yield a cuisine built on walnuts, cheese and cereals. Influenced by neighboring Guria, Imeretian dishes use ground walnuts, fragrant herbs and hearty grains. The classic Imeruli cheese bread (khachapuri) is made here, but the region also boasts its own spin on many national dishes. An assortment of pkhali and accompaniments is collectively called “gobi,” symbolizing friendship at the table. Local cheeses abound and wild mushrooms add earthy depth.

dishes.name: Pkhali
dishes.description: Chilled walnut-vegetable pâtés made from spinach, beet tops, or cabbage, blended with walnuts, garlic, fenugreek, and vinegar, garnished with pomegranate seeds.

dishes.name: Mchadi
dishes.description: Golden cornmeal flatbreads, dense and slightly sweet, served with cheese or soups.

dishes.name: Badrijani Nigvzit
dishes.description: Fried eggplant rolls stuffed with spiced walnut paste and topped with pomegranate seeds.

dishes.name: Kuchmachi
dishes.description: Liver stew of chicken or pork livers sautéed with onions, cilantro, garlic, and rich walnut-pomegranate sauce.

dishes.name: Lobio
dishes.description: Spiced red bean stew flavored with blue fenugreek and marigold, served soupy or baked with a cheese crust.

dishes.name: Imeruli Khachapuri
dishes.description: Round cheese bread filled with Imeretian sulguni cheese.

sections.title: Samegrelo
sections.intro: Samegrelo (Megrelia) is the spice-loving heart of Georgia. Megrelian cooks liberally use hot red pepper paste (ajika), aromatic coriander and, of course, walnuts. Cornmeal (ghomi) and cheese (Sulguni) are also regional signatures. The cuisine here is known for bold, spicy flavors and comfort dishes that center around cornmeal porridge and cheese-enriched grits.

dishes.name: Ghomi & Elarji
dishes.description: Cornmeal porridge (ghomi) and its cheese-enriched version (elarji) served with meats or stews.

dishes.name: Megrelian Khachapuri
dishes.description: Cheese bread with extra sulguni cheese piled on top of the filled loaf.

dishes.name: Ajika-spiced Chicken Tabaka
dishes.description: Pan-seared chicken under a weight, slathered with fiery Megrelian ajika.

dishes.name: Megrelian Kharcho
dishes.description: Smoky beef-and-tomato stew thickened with walnuts and fenugreek, often spiced with ajika.

dishes.name: Gebjalia
dishes.description: Fresh cheese rolls with mint, dressed in yogurt and spices.

sections.title: Adjara
sections.intro: Adjara is a subtropical coastal corner blending Georgian and Ottoman influences. Upland Adjara favors dairy and hearty fare, while seaside cuisine features herbs, vegetables and fish. The region is home to Georgia’s most famous khachapuri style: Adjarian khachapuri, a boat-shaped bread filled with molten cheeses and topped with egg and butter.

dishes.name: Adjarian Khachapuri
dishes.description: Boat-shaped bread filled with molten cheese, topped with a raw egg yolk and butter, mixed at the table.

dishes.name: Borano
dishes.description: Pan-fried cheese curds in clarified butter.

dishes.name: Malakhto
dishes.description: Bean mash of kidney beans ground with walnuts, raw grape juice, and oil.

dishes.name: Chirbuli
dishes.description: Fluffy omelette spiked with walnuts and tomatoes.

dishes.name: Sinori
dishes.description: Rolled dough sheets filled with fresh Nadughi cheese, fried and drizzled with butter.

dishes.name: Black Sea Fish Stew
dishes.description: Local fish simmered in tomato-garlic sauces with tarragon.

venues: Laguna and seaside taverns in Batumi

sections.title: Racha-Lechkhumi
sections.intro: Highland Racha (with neighbor Lechkhumi) is rugged and cold, so its cuisine is warming and richly flavored. Dairy, bacon and garlic are prominent, offering comforting dishes like shakmeruli (garlic chicken) and succulent cured meats.

dishes.name: Shkmeruli
dishes.description: Roasted chicken braised in a creamy milk-garlic sauce.

dishes.name: Lori (Pork Belly)
dishes.description: Cured and smoked pork belly fried or grilled.

dishes.name: Lobiani
dishes.description: Bean-filled bread with spiced red beans and bacon.

dishes.name: Rachuli Khachapuri
dishes.description: Square cheese bread often made with buckwheat or wheat flour.

dishes.name: Kvanchkara
dishes.description: Semi-sweet red wine made from Aleksandrouli and Mujuretuli grapes.

sections.title: Svaneti
sections.intro: Svaneti’s mountain farmers rely on whatever they grow or raise at 2,000m. Cornmeal, barley, potatoes and home cheeses feature in a simple, hearty cuisine. This region’s dishes are robust and sustaining, designed to fuel hard work and withstand severe winters.

dishes.name: Kubdari
dishes.description: Meat pie filled with spiced minced pork or beef and baked until golden.

dishes.name: Chvishtari
dishes.description: Cornbread with cheese pockets, fried or baked.

dishes.name: Lutspeq
dishes.description: Barley or buckwheat porridge with garlic, salt, pepper, and meat bits.

dishes.name: Tashmijabi
dishes.description: Mashed potatoes mixed with crumbled cheese, butter, and garlic.

dishes.name: Guda Cheese
dishes.description: Sheep’s-milk cheese aged in goatskins.

venues: Households and guesthouses in Mestia and Ushguli

sections.title: Tusheti
sections.intro: Tusheti lies in Georgia’s extreme northeast, a plateau of alpine meadows and sheep pastures. Its cuisine is austere yet bold, reflecting nomadic herding life. Locally-grown herbs, saltbush berries and plenty of meat and cheese define Tushetian food.

dishes.name: Lamb Khinkali
dishes.description: Thick-wrapped dumplings filled with lamb or goat and spices.

dishes.name: Kothi/Kotori
dishes.description: Cottage-cheese pie similar to khachapuri but square and herb-filled.

dishes.name: Guda Cheese
dishes.description: Strong sheep’s-milk cheese aged in skin, often grilled.

dishes.name: Chvishtari
dishes.description: Cornbread with cheese pockets.

dishes.name: Lobio
dishes.description: Spiced red bean stew.

venues: Folk restaurants in Tbilisi like Pictograma

sections.title: Tbilisi
sections.intro: Tbilisi is a melting pot of every regional specialty. The capital’s food scene ranges from steaming street kiosks to refined dining, blending Persian, Turkish, Russian and Armenian influences. Yet the supra spirit holds – communal, generous and always paired with wine or chacha toasts.

dishes.name: Street Khachapuri
dishes.description: Various regional styles of cheese bread sold from kiosks.

dishes.name: Khinkali
dishes.description: Classic soup dumplings available at markets.

dishes.name: Pkhali
dishes.description: Assortment of vegetable-walnut pâtés.

dishes.name: Lobio
dishes.description: Hearty red bean stew.

dishes.name: Modern Interpretations
dishes.description: Gourmet reimaginings of classics at restaurants like Barbarestan and Cafe Littera.
